titles.ar: باب  فِي أَنَّهُ لَا يَكُونُ شَيْ‏ءٌ فِي السَّمَاءِ وَ الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا بِسَبْعَةٍ
titles.en: Chapter 25 – Regarding that there is nothing coming into being in the skies and the earth except with seven (characteristics)
The Book of Tawheed (Oneness of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>)
Chapter 26 – The Desire and the Intention

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (155/ 2)

parts.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ الدَّيْلَمِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْهَاشِمِيِّ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ لَا يَكُونُ شَيْ‏ءٌ إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ وَ أَرَادَ وَ قَدَّرَ وَ قَضَى قُلْتُ مَا مَعْنَى شَاءَ قَالَ ابْتِدَاءُ الْفِعْلِ قُلْتُ مَا مَعْنَى قَدَّرَ قَالَ تَقْدِيرُ الشَّيْ‏ءِ مِنْ طُولِهِ وَ عَرْضِهِ قُلْتُ مَا مَعْنَى قَضَى قَالَ إِذَا قَضَى أَمْضَاهُ فَذَلِكَ الَّذِي لَا مَرَدَّ لَهُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad Bin Abdullah, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from his father, from Muhammad Bin Suleyman Al Dalaymi, from Ali Bin Ibrahim Al Hashimy who said,

‘I heard Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup> Bin Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Nothing comes into being except what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> so Desires, and Intends, and Determines, and Ordains’. I said, ‘What is the meaning of Desire?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Initiating the deed’. I said, ‘What is the meaning of determination?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Determining the things, from its length, and its width’. I said, ‘What is the meaning of Ordaining?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When it is Ordained, it is accomplished. So that is which, there is no averting for it’.
en.sarwar: 1. It is narrated from Ali ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Abdallah from Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abdallah from his father from Muhammad ibn Sulayman al-Daylami from Ali ibn Ibrahim al-Hashimi who has said the following. “I heard abu al-Hassan Musa ibn Ja‘far (a.s.) saying, ‘There can nothing until Allah would wish it to be, will, measure and decree.” I asked what is the meaning of wish (Sha’a)? The Imam replied, “It is to begin the act.” I asked, “What is the meaning of measure (Qaddara)? The Imam replied, “It is measuring the length and the width of something.” I asked what is the meaning of decree (Qada)? The Imam replied, “When He decrees He lets it happen and this is when it becomes unavoidable to happen.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/155)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) شَاءَ وَ أَرَادَ وَ قَدَّرَ وَ قَضَى قَالَ نَعَمْ قُلْتُ وَ أَحَبَّ قَالَ لَا قُلْتُ وَ كَيْفَ شَاءَ وَ أَرَادَ وَ قَدَّرَ وَ قَضَى وَ لَمْ يُحِبَّ قَالَ هَكَذَا خَرَجَ إِلَيْنَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus Bin Abdul Rahman, from Aban, from Abu Baseer who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘(He<sup>azwj</sup>) ‘شَاءَ وَ أَرَادَ وَ قَدَّرَ وَ قَضَى’ Desires, and Intends, and Determines and Ordains?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’. I said, ‘And He<sup>azwj</sup> Loves?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No’. I said, ‘And how does He<sup>azwj</sup> Desires, and Intends, and Determines, and Ordains, and He<sup>azwj</sup> does not Love?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This is how it has come out to us<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 2. It is narrated from Ali ibn Ibrahim from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus ibn ‘Abd al-Rahman from Aban from abu Basir who has said the following. “asked abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) about, “(Allah) Wished, Willed, Measured and Decreed.” The Imam said, “Yes.” I asked, “Did He love?” The Imam said, “No.” I asked, “How is it that He wished, willed measured and decreed but did not love?” The Imam said, “This is how it has come to us.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (157/ 2)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَعْبَدٍ عَنْ وَاصِلِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ أَمَرَ اللَّهُ وَ لَمْ يَشَأْ وَ شَاءَ وَ لَمْ يَأْمُرْ أَمَرَ إِبْلِيسَ أَنْ يَسْجُدَ لآِدَمَ وَ شَاءَ أَنْ لَا يَسْجُدَ وَ لَوْ شَاءَ لَسَجَدَ وَ نَهَى آدَمَ عَنْ أَكْلِ الشَّجَرَةِ وَ شَاءَ أَنْ يَأْكُلَ مِنْهَا وَ لَوْ لَمْ يَشَأْ لَمْ يَأْكُلْ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ali Bin Ma’bad, from Wasil Bin Suleyman, from Abdullah Bin Sinan,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I heard him<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Commands and does not Desire, and Desires and does not Command. He<sup>azwj</sup> Commanded Iblees<sup>la</sup> that he<sup>la</sup> should prostrate to Adam<sup>as</sup> and Desired that he<sup>la</sup> does not prostrate, and had He<sup>azwj</sup> Desired so, he<sup>la</sup> would have prostrated; and He<sup>azwj</sup> Forbade Adam<sup>as</sup> from eating from the tree, and Desired that he<sup>as</sup> eats from eat, and had He<sup>azwj</sup> not Desired so, he<sup>as</sup> would not have eaten’.
en.sarwar: 3. It is narrated from Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Aloi ibn Ma‘bad from Wasil ibn Sulayman from ‘Abdallah ibn Sinan who has said the following. “I hear Imam abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) saying, “Allah commanded but did not want. He wanted but did not command. He commanded Satan to prostrate but He did not want it. If He wanted Satan would have prostrated. He prohibited Adam from eating of the tree and wanted him to eat. Had He not wanted he would not have ate.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (161/ 2)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنِ الْمُخْتَارِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْهَمْدَانِيِّ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الْعَلَوِيِّ جَمِيعاً عَنِ الْفَتْحِ بْنِ يَزِيدَ الْجُرْجَانِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ لِلَّهِ إِرَادَتَيْنِ وَ مَشِيئَتَيْنِ إِرَادَةَ حَتْمٍ وَ إِرَادَةَ عَزْمٍ يَنْهَى وَ هُوَ يَشَاءُ وَ يَأْمُرُ وَ هُوَ لَا يَشَاءُ أَ وَ مَا رَأَيْتَ أَنَّهُ نَهَى آدَمَ وَ زَوْجَتَهُ أَنْ يَأْكُلَا مِنَ الشَّجَرَةِ وَ شَاءَ ذَلِكَ وَ لَوْ لَمْ يَشَأْ أَنْ يَأْكُلَا لَمَا غَلَبَتْ مَشِيئَتُهُمَا مَشِيئَةَ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى
وَ أَمَرَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ أَنْ يَذْبَحَ إِسْحَاقَ وَ لَمْ يَشَأْ أَنْ يَذْبَحَهُ وَ لَوْ شَاءَ لَمَا غَلَبَتْ مَشِيئَةُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ مَشِيئَةَ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Al Mukhtar Bin Muhammad Al Hamadany and Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, from Abdullah Bin Al Hassan Al Alawy, altogether, from Al Fatah Bin Yazeed Al Jurjany,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For Allah<sup>azwj</sup> there are two Intentions and two Desires – an Absolute Intention and a Determined Intention. He<sup>azwj</sup> Forbids while He<sup>azwj</sup> Desires, and He<sup>azwj</sup> Commands while He<sup>azwj</sup> does not Desire. Or did you not see that He<sup>azwj</sup> Forbade Adam<sup>as</sup> and his<sup>as</sup> wife<sup>as</sup> from eating from the tree, and He<sup>azwj</sup> Desired that, and had He<sup>azwj</sup> not Desired that they<sup>as</sup> both eat, their<sup>as</sup> both desires would not have prevailed over the Desire of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> the Exalted.

And He<sup>azwj</sup> Commanded Ibrahim<sup>as</sup> that he<sup>as</sup> slaughers Is’haq<sup>as</sup> (Ismail<sup>as</sup>) and did not Desire that he<sup>as</sup> slaughters him<sup>as</sup>. And had He<sup>azwj</sup> so Desired, the desire of Ibrahim<sup>as</sup> would not have prevailed over the Desire of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> the Exalted’.
en.sarwar: 4. It is narrated from Ali ibn Ibrahim from al-Mukhtar ibn Muhammad al-Hamadani and Muhammad ibn al-Hassan from ‘Abdallah ibn al-Hassan al-‘Alawi altogether from al-Fath ibn Yazid al-Jurjani from abu al-Hassan (a.s.) who has said the following. “Allah has two wills and two wishes. He has a definite will and an intended will. He prohibits but He wants it. He commands but He does not want it. Consider that He prohibited Adam and his spouse from eating of the tree but He wanted them to eat. Had He not wanted their wish would not have surpassed Allah’s wish. He commanded Ibrahim to slaughter Ishaq but He did not want it to happen. Had He wanted it the wish of Ibrahim would not have surpassed the wish of Allah, the Most High.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (162/ 2)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَعْبَدٍ عَنْ دُرُسْتَ بْنِ أَبِي مَنْصُورٍ عَنْ فُضَيْلِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ شَاءَ وَ أَرَادَ وَ لَمْ يُحِبَّ وَ لَمْ يَرْضَ شَاءَ أَنْ لَا يَكُونَ شَيْ‏ءٌ إِلَّا بِعِلْمِهِ وَ أَرَادَ مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ وَ لَمْ يُحِبَّ أَنْ يُقَالَ ثَالِثُ ثَلَاثَةٍ وَ لَمْ يَرْضَ لِعِبَادِهِ الْكُفْرَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ali Bin Ma’bad, from Dorost Bin Abu Mansour, from Fuzayl Bin Yasaar who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘He<sup>azwj</sup> Desires and Intends, and He<sup>azwj</sup> does not Love and does not get Pleased. He<sup>azwj</sup> Desires that a thing does not come into being except in His<sup>azwj</sup> Knowledge, and He<sup>azwj</sup> Intends similar to that, and He<sup>azwj</sup> does not Love for it to said He<sup>azwj</sup> is third of three, and is not Pleased of the disbelief for His<sup>azwj</sup> servants’.
en.sarwar: 5. It is narrated from Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ali ibn Ma‘bad from Durost ibn abu Mansur from Fudayl ibn Yasar who has said the following. “I heard Imam abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) saying, ‘He wanted and willed and did not love and did not agree. He wanted something nor to happen except in His knowledge and He willed in the same way but He did not love it to be said, “The third of the three and He did not agree that His servants become unbelievers.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/162)

parts.text: أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ اللَّهُ يَا ابْنَ آدَمَ بِمَشِيئَتِي كُنْتَ أَنْتَ الَّذِي تَشَاءُ لِنَفْسِكَ مَا تَشَاءُ وَ بِقُوَّتِي أَدَّيْتَ فَرَائِضِي وَ بِنِعْمَتِي قَوِيتَ عَلَى مَعْصِيَتِي جَعَلْتُكَ سَمِيعاً بَصِيراً قَوِيّاً مَا أَصَابَكَ مِنْ حَسَنَةٍ فَمِنَ اللَّهِ وَ مَا أَصَابَكَ مِنْ سَيِّئَةٍ فَمِنْ نَفْسِكَ وَ ذَاكَ أَنِّي أَوْلَى بِحَسَنَاتِكَ مِنْكَ وَ أَنْتَ أَوْلَى بِسَيِّئَاتِكَ مِنِّي وَ ذَاكَ أَنَّنِي لَا أُسْأَلُ عَمَّا أَفْعَلُ وَ هُمْ يُسْأَلُونَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abu Nasr who said,

‘Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Said: “O son of Adam<sup>as</sup>! By My<sup>azwj</sup> Desire you came into being. You desire for your own self whatever you so desire; and by My<sup>azwj</sup> Strength you are fulfilling My<sup>azwj</sup> Obligations, and by My<sup>azwj</sup> Favour I<sup>azwj</sup> Given you the Strength (so you may) disobey My<sup>azwj</sup>. I<sup>azwj</sup> Made you to be hearing, seeing, strong. Whatever you attain from a goodness, so (it is) from Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and whatever you attain from evil, so it is from yourself, and that is because I<sup>azwj</sup> am closer with your good deeds than you are, and you are closer with your evil deeds than I<sup>azwj</sup> am, and that I<sup>azwj</sup> will not be Questioned about what I<sup>azwj</sup> Do, but they would be questioned’.
en.sarwar: 6. It is narrated from Muhammad ibn Yahya from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn abu Nasr who has that Imam abul Hassan al-Rida has said the following. “Allah said, ‘O son of Adam through My wish you came into existence and it is you who wish for yourself whatever you wish. Through My power you fulfill your obligations and through My bounties you receive strength to disobey Me. I made you made you to hear and see and be strong. Whatever good you receive is from Allah and whatever evil afflicts you is from your own-self. It is because I have priority to your good deeds and you have priority to your bad deeds. This is because I Ahmad ibn Muhammad not asked what I do but they are questioned ffor what they do.”
